name: Ainge

attributes.attribute: magically defended against the theft of the logs she was gathering by transforming them into living trees
owned a tub or Cauldron in which water would ebb and flow as though it were the tide

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Irish mythology tells of Ainge, a goddess and daughter of the Dagda. Ainge displayed her magical abilities by defending against the theft of logs she was gathering by transforming them into living trees. Additionally, she possessed a tub, or Cauldron, that exhibited water flowing in and out as if it were the tide.
